full_text:
Thanks. It's not so much evolution, it's using what I have, like the scrap 
piece of aluminum for the panel. The next "evolution" will be the printed 
circuit board. Of course I keep adding functions, which means more board 
real estate, which raises costs. I really want the linear sweep, and tone 
injection to be standard functions. It would be interesting to use all 
stereo speakers, and mics in the echo boxes, but that almost doubles the 
components again. I've thought about a stripped down version, like just the 
tuner and sweep generator, then use something like a boom box for the all 
the audio and recording functions. If it was only linear sweep, the system 
could be made on a small board===cheap.

Frank-S
